statement.p:
Use the definition of a root to simplify without using a calculator.
(\sqrt[3]{125})^3=
(\sqrt[4]{2})^4=
(\sqrt[3]{7})^3=
\left(2\sqrt[3]{12} \right)^3
\left(-a^3\sqrt[4]{a^2} \right)^4
(-x^2\sqrt[3]{2x})^3=
Complete the table converting radicals to powers.

introduction.p: For Problems 7 and 8, write each expression in radical form.
For Problems 9 and 10, write each expression in exponential form.
For Problems 1114, write the expression as a sum of terms of the form kx^p.
For Problems 2126, solve for the indicated variable.

statement.p: T = 2\pi\sqrt{\dfrac{L}{g}}~~~~ for L
r = \sqrt{t^2-s^2}~~~~ for s
d = \sqrt[3] {\dfrac{16Mr^2}{m}}~~~~ for M
R = \sqrt[4] {\dfrac{8Lvf}{\pi p}}~~~~ for p
T = \sqrt[4] {\dfrac{E}{SA}}~~~~ for A
r = \sqrt[3] {\dfrac{3V}{4 \pi}}~~~~ for V

Graph each set of functions in the given window. What do you observe?
y_1=\sqrt{x},~y_2=x^2,~y_3=x \text{Xmin} \amp = 0 \amp\amp \text{Xmax} = 4 \text{Ymin} \amp = 0 \amp\amp \text{Ymax} = 4
y_1=\sqrt[3]{x},~y_2=x^3,~y_3=x \text{Xmin} \amp = -4 \amp\amp \text{Xmax} = 4 \text{Ymin} \amp = -4 \amp\amp \text{Ymax} = 4

The period of a pendulum is the time it takes for the pendulum to complete one entire swing, from left to right and back again. The greater the length, L, of the pendulum, the longer its period, T. In fact, if L is measured in feet, then the period is given in seconds by T=2\pi\sqrt{\frac{L}{32}}
Write the formula for T as a power function in the form f (x) = kx^p.
The Foucault pendulum in the Convention Center in Portland, Oregon is 90 feet long. What is its period?
Choose a suitable window and graph the function T=f(L). Label the point corresponding to point (b) on the graph.

The rate, r, in feet per second, at which water flows from a fire hose varies directly with the square root of the water pressure, P, in psi (pounds per square inch). What is the rate of water flow at a typical water pressure of 60 psi?

li.p: Find the value of k and write a power function relating the variables.

ol.li: What is the rate of water flow at a typical water pressure of 60 psi?

li.p: Graph your function and verify your answer to part (b) on the graph.

statement.p:
Thanks to improvements in technology, the annual electricity cost of running most major appliances has decreased steadily since 1970. The average annual cost of running a refrigerator is given, in dollars, by the function C(t) = 148- 28 t^{1/3} where t is the number of years since 1970.
How much did it cost to run a refrigerator in 1980? In 1990?
When was the cost of running a refrigerator half of the cost in 1970? If the cost continues to decline according to the given function, when will it cost $50 per year to run a refrigerator?
Graph the function C(t). Do you think that the cost will continue to decline indefinitely according to the given function? Why or why not?

A rough estimate for the radius of the nucleus of an atom is provided by the formula r=kA^{1/3} where A is the mass number of the nucleus and k\approx 1.3 \times 10^{-13} centimeter.
Estimate the radius of the nucleus of an atom of iodine-127, which has mass number 127. If the nucleus is roughly spherical, what is its volume?
The nuclear mass of iodine-127 is 2.1 \times 10^{-22} gram. What is the density of the nucleus? (Density is mass per unit volume.)
Complete the table of values for the radii of various radioisotopes.
Element Carbon Potassium Cobalt Technetium Radium
Massnumber, A 14 40 60 99 226
Radius, r
Sketch a graph of r as a function of A. (Use units of 10^{-13} centimeter on the vertical axis.)

li.p: Graph the functions ~~f (x) = 4 \sqrt[3]{x - 9}~~ and ~~g(x) = 12~~ in the window {\text{Xmin}} \amp = 0 \amp\amp {\text{Xmax}} = 47 {\text{Ymin}} \amp = -8 \amp\amp {\text{Ymax}} = 16
Use the graph to solve the equation 4 \sqrt[3]{x - 9}=12.
Graph the functions ~~f (x) = 6+2 \sqrt[4]{12-x}~~ and ~~g(x) = 10~~ in the window {\text{Xmin}} \amp = -27 \amp\amp {\text{Xmax}} = 20 {\text{Ymin}} \amp = 4 \amp\amp {\text{Ymax}} = 12
Use the graph to solve the equation 6+2 \sqrt[4]{12-x}=10.
